content: **skill level** intermediate **finished measurements** circumference 23 height 7 **gauge** 5 5 blooms and 7 rnds = 4 take time to check gauge **yarn** yarn citizen trinity cashmere lace weight 49% super baby alpaca 39% mulberry silk 12% cashmere 247yds/25g per ball 1 ball shown in ocean **materials** hook us size i/9 5 5mm crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge notions locking stitch marker tapestry needle **pattern notes** make sure to pull up the loops to an even height approx 0 5 each the jasmine stitch is created by linking multiple stitches together resulting in a repeating floral design to do this you ll work three petal stitches in a row without finishing them individually instead they are joined at the end forming the base of a three-petaled flower in the next round the base of each stitch serves as the foundation for the following set of petals allowing the pattern to flow smoothly once you become familiar with the jasmine stitch it feels natural to work with its simple one-round repeat it s easy to memorize and stitch without difficulty
